channel.title: Itemhandler problems
channel.description:
Im using the base of Ultimate pk and trying to add silab items for updating and other things also but when i added them and ran runeserver it says [code]Starting pimpscape Server on 0.0.0.0:5555 Exception in thread "main" java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 6 at ItemHandler.loadItemList(ItemHandler.java:312) at ItemHandler.<init>(ItemHandler.java:39) at server.main(server.java:28)
[/code]

item.title: Itemhandler problems
item.dc:creator: @owned_ur_ass owned ur ass
item.description:
@owned_ur_ass wrote:

Ok now thats fixed but when i do skill cape commands it loggs me out any idea?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 08, 2007, 07:01:37 AM[/size][hr]Starting pimpscape Server on 0.0.0.0:43594 ClientHandler: Accepted from localhost:1593 Client type: high memory version UserId: 82128902 owned ur ass is signing onto server. LOADED: 3 [client-1-owned ur ass]: playerCommand: skillcapes java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 14073 at client.addItem(client.java:12595) at client.customCommand(client.java:11350) at client.parseIncomingPackets(client.java:17977) at client.packetProcess(client.java:14509) at client.process(client.java:14479) at PlayerHandler.process(PlayerHandler.java:137) at server.main(server.java:47) Ultimate PK Server [fatal] - exception Game saved for player owned ur ass ClientHandler: Client owned ur ass disconnected. ClientHandler: Accepted from localhost:1598 Client type: high memory version UserId: 82128902 owned ur ass is signing onto server. LOADED: 3 Game saved for player owned ur ass ClientHandler: Client owned ur ass disconnected.

Line 47 in server.java playerHandler.process();

Read full topic

item.title: Itemhandler problems
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

owned ur ass:

http://rafb.net/p/7aujgt56.html[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 08, 2007, 12:37:25 AM[/size][hr]you get it?

Here’s a quick fix;
In ItemHandler, underneath loadItemList(“item.cfg”);
Add;
loadItemList(“item2.cfg”);

And take a big chunk out of item.cfg and put it into item2.cfg.

Read full topic

item.title: Itemhandler problems
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

You’re trying to access a variable inside an array which does not exist, thus the index being out of bounds…

So, say I went to access the memory allocation 9999 in an array like this;
anArray[9999] = 999;

But my array had only 9989 memory allocation’s like this;
int[] anArray = new int[9989];

It would throw that exception.

Read full topic
